title: How to Convert Pounds to Euros

steps.title: Find the current exchange rate online.
steps.content: Find the current exchange rate online. Currency exchange rates vary from day to day, month to month, and year to year, so it’s essential to find the most up-to-date rate to do your conversions. Do a simple search for “currency exchange rates” and select “GBP to EUR” or visit https://www.x-rates.com/calculator/?from=GBP&to=EUR&amount=1 . [1] X Research source As of August 31, 2018, the conversion rate is 1.00 Pound = 1.116479 Euro.

steps.title: Round the exchange rate to 3 decimals.
steps.content: Round the exchange rate to 3 decimals. Though the exchange rates can have up to 6 decimals, it’s okay to use only 3 decimals when doing currency conversions. [2] X Research source So, instead of using 1.116479, you can use 1.117.

steps.title: Multiply the number of Pounds by the current exchange rate.
steps.content: Multiply the number of Pounds by the current exchange rate. In this case, the exchange rate is 1.116, so multiply the specified number of Pounds by 1.116 to find out how many Euros the Pounds are worth. [3] X Research source For instance, if you have 50 Pounds, multiply 50 by 1.116, which equals 55.85 Euros. If you have 10,000 Pounds, multiply 10,000 by 1.116, which equals 11,170 Euros.

steps.title: Use an online conversion calculator for a quick, convenient option.
steps.content: Use an online conversion calculator for a quick, convenient option. If you don’t want to do the conversion by hand, there are tons of online calculators that you can use for free. In fact, many of the sites that provide currency conversions contain calculators, including https://www.x-rates.com .

steps.title: Check the current conversion rate online.
steps.content: Check the current conversion rate online. In order to find out if you’re getting a good deal on the exchange from a currency seller, exchange office, bank, or other retailer, look up the conversion rate online. Simply search for “current GBP to EUR exchange rate.” You can then compare this rate to the rate the seller or exchange office offers you. [4] X Research source For instance, go to https://www.x-rates.com/calculator/?from=GBP&to=EUR&amount=1 to see the rates for the specific day you visit the site. Note that the rate fluctuates from day to day.

steps.title: Compare rates between currency sellers and exchange offices to find the best one.
steps.content: Compare rates between currency sellers and exchange offices to find the best one. Various currency sellers will have widely different rates, so you’ll need to do some homework in order to find a good deal. Simply search for “currency sellers near me” online and view the rates from banks, post offices, brokers, and other retailers. Once you find the best rate, follow the instructions on the web page in order to find out how to exchange your money. [5] X Research source If you have time, you can order the money online. If not, you can visit a retailer to make the exchange directly. Be aware that some companies charge a fee for exchanging money, so be sure to take that into account when looking for the best rate.

steps.title: Withdraw money from an ATM in a country that uses the Euro for an easy option.
steps.content: Withdraw money from an ATM in a country that uses the Euro for an easy option. If you’re visiting a country that uses the Euro, you can simply withdraw Euros from your bank account whenever you need cash. However, you’ll be stuck with whatever exchange rate the bank offers on that day. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Avoid doing currency exchanges at the airport.
steps.content: Avoid doing currency exchanges at the airport. Though it might seem like the easiest option if you’re going on holiday in a country that uses Euros, stay away from exchange counters at the airport. The rates will not be in your favor and you’ll get less Euros than you would from other retailers. [7] X Research source
